title: Add a transition in a process
content:
The following task describes how to add a transition within a process in Studio.

Note  

If you have development and production tenants, all configuration changes must be made on the development tenant. For more information about synchronizing the tenants, see Dev2Prod - How to synchronize your development and production tenants.

Supported transition scenarios

There are cases where you want to allow multiple transitions between two phases, for use cases such as automatic closure co-existing with manual closure. The following rules apply when you work with transitions:

  • Between two phases that belong to different metaphases, you can add up to two transitions that are of different types (manual and automatic) in the same direction. That said, there can be up to four transitions between two phases that aren't in the same metaphase.
  • Between two phases that belong to the same metaphase, you can add up to two transitions that meet one of the following requirements:
    • They are in the same direction but of different types (manual and automatic)
    • They are in different directions (either of the same type or different types)

The following diagram depicts the supported transition scenarios based on the rules described above:

  • Cross metaphases: Phases A and B belong to different metaphases
  • Inside one metaphase: Phases A and B belong to the same metaphase

Limitation

The following transition scenarios aren't supported (where phases A and B belong to the same metaphase).

How to add transitions

  1. In the main menu, select Administration > Configuration > Studio.

  2. Select a record type from the drop-down box at the top of the screen and select the Processes and Rules tab.

  3. Select a process on the left-side pane.

  4. Select a phase in the process and click the Add transition icon . Alternatively, select a phase in the tree on the left, click Edit and click the Add transition icon .

  5. In the Add transition dialog box, select the desired phase and the direction of the transition.

  6. Click OK.

    Tip Alternatively, you can select a transition and click the Duplicate transition icon . In the Duplicate Transition dialog box, perform the same steps as above.

  7. Select the Properties tab for the new transition and set the transition type as either automatic or manual.

    • For automatic transitions, enter the condition in the Expression language. For more information, see Expression Language.
    • For manual transitions, enter the Action caption and select the Primary action check box if relevant. The primary actions are sorted first in the drop-down list of available manual transitions.
    Caution If there is already at least one existing transition between the two phases, make sure that the new transition will not result in an unsupported transition scenario. For example, if there is already an automatic transition, you must not add another automatic transition in the same direction; otherwise, an error will occur later when you attempt to save the workflow.

  8. Click Save to save your changes.

Note You can't add transitions in a process while in Comparison mode. You must switch to Standard mode to add the transitions.
